page.title: 07House renovation in Compton.
page.content: A long low thatched cottage stands at the junction of the main road and Ham Lane. It was recently sold by its dedicated owner who had completely renovated it twice,having started this mammoth task about 14 years ago. When Mr Fry bought this now delightful residence,its only{water supply}was from a pump in the garden,so his first job was to install mains water and drainage. He totally wired up all the electricity,had heating installed.Then just as he was{rethatching}it himself, it burnt down.He had to do everything again, rethatching as well. This time, however, he impregnated the walls, extended the byre into utility and rear entrance hall,the milking parlour became the kitchen.The drawing room was made up of the whole of the front of the house.He built a separate garage with study and store attached.
